title: FeO + C Coupled reactions - K and sign of delta G

content.description: <math alttext="2 F e O, solid, is in equilibrium with 2 F e, solid, plus O 2, gas; K sub equilibrium equals 1 times 10 to the negative 6 at 1000 Kelvin" display="block" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> F</mtext><mtext>eO</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⇄</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> F</mtext><mtext>e</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="3.0em"></mspace><mo>⁢</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>at</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mn>1000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: <math alttext="C O 2, gas, is in equilibrium with C, solid, plus O 2, gas; K sub equilibrium equals 1 times 10 to the negative 32 at 1000 Kelvin" display="block" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⇄</mo><mtext>C</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="3.0em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>32</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>at</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mn>1000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> The formation of <math alttext="F e, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O 2, gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> from <math alttext="F e O, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FeO</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is not thermodynamically favorable at room temperature. In an effort to make the process favorable, <math alttext="C, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to the <math alttext="F e O, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FeO</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at elevated temperatures. Based on the information above, which of the following gives the value of <math alttext="K sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and the sign of <math alttext="delta G naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction represented by the equation below at <math alttext="1000 Kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?<math alttext="2 F e O, solid, plus C, solid, is in equilibrium with 2 F e, solid, plus C O 2, gas" display="block" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> F</mtext><mtext>eO</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>C</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>⇄</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> F</mtext><mtext>e</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="delta G naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="1 times 10 to the negative 38" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>38</mn></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>Positive

<math alttext="K sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="delta G naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="1 times 10 to the 26 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>26</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>Negative

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="delta G naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="1 times 10 to the 26 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>26</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>Negative

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
